website_summaries.verdict: This little set has all you need to get started growing salad greens including quality, non-GMO seeds produced without pesticides or herbicides.
pros: Kit for salad connoisseurs and indoor gardeners
Includes pre-seeded pods with 6 types of lettuce seeds
Backed by a 100% germination or replacement guarantee

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH LETTUCE!!! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They grow fast and with the 6 pod I can have a few salads a week ongoing. I would suggest staggering when you put them in a few weeks apart- that will give you plenty of lettuce for a longer time. If my review was helpful to you, please click the yes button below! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Dehne

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have fresh lettuce! But... the lettuce is pretty weak
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the first Aerogrows many years ago, and loved it. Ordered the "Harvest Elite" this time. Love it. I also ordered the Salad Greens Mix pod set. I had mixed results. Two of the pods just didn't want to sprout. Tried again. No luck. The lettuce that grew, grew quickly. It was nice to have fresh lettuce! The only reason I may not buy this again is that the lettuce is pretty fragile for salads. It doesn't get that strength needed to hold up to salad dressings and toppings. It was quite wilty. The convenience of having it there was fantastic. I may experiment with different types of lettuce to choose a heartier one.
customer_reviews.author: Dht

customer_reviews.title: Yay, more salad!
customer_reviews.text: I get about two salads a week from this (harvesting with the "haircut method"), which is great because I typically buy salad mix on Saturday with good intentions, forget about it in my fridge by Tuesday, and have a gross box of mystery green liquid to throw out two weeks later. Flavor is good and it's as easy to grow as everything else has been in my aerogrow. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen G.

customer_reviews.title: Lucious Greens make a great salad.
customer_reviews.text: This is producing lots of different lettuce. I have picked several bunches for salad ... It's great. Love this organic lettuce. No sprays or worries. It taste great and very tender leaves. Grows like crazy. Thanks .. It's a great product. Seven salad seed pods and all are growing great.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Only one pod out of this box germinated. I called customer support and they said wait the full 21 days. I have and nada. (Dill, 2-basil, parsley, lettuce = 5 no grow) I am not paying for shipping for a new box. I gave 1 stars because the one pod (lettuce) that germinated is growing like gang busters! For the price, and the guarantee they would grow spiel, I expect better service and better product. Now the tomatoes on the other hand gave me life! but I really wanted the herbs and spices.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Klem

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: We were able to grow 4/6 lettuce pods (other 2 wouldn’t grow, we replaced them with a jalapeño & tomato pods). It took 23 days to get some salad, it was absolutely delicious! There’s nothing like growing your own salad, especially if you eat it as often as we do. Definitely will be ordering these again in a few weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Ca.Sunkissed

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Aero garden makes good systems. And i love the pods. giving 1 star because it didnt come with the spacer caps like advertised. AND i only picked this particular refill pack because it came with those caps and my system did not. ( for those of you that don't know. You cant use all the slots when growing larger plants like the tomatos, or they will crowd. The spacer caps help prevent harmful algae growth. So they're kinda important in a box of tomato seed pods)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t always grow
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend Aerogrow. They guarantee your plants will grow, but only half of what I have planted even sprouts. I reached out to them asking for replacement pods. They said they would send me some within 10 days. Two weeks later they hadn’t arrived. I emailed them again and they never responded. They plant food they sent also started molding so it was unusable. The veggies and herbs that did grow were great, but if 50% of the pods don’t work you have to buy so many extras. It’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Eastin

customer_reviews.title: Hope you REALLY like lettuce
customer_reviews.text: One of the seed kits that ALWAYS overproduces. Can get a couple salads a week from this, as well as feeding a couple leaves a day to our guinea pig. Only wish all the seed kits from AeroGarden were this productive.
customer_reviews.author: Ewan Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Impressive - fast and tasty!
customer_reviews.text: I definitely got more than expected with these. With all the Romaine recalls I decided to grow my own. My expectations were not high since I've had mixed results with several items in my AeroGarden. These came up within 2 days and are the healthiest plants I've grown. The leaves are firm and crispy which is just how I like them. I planted 5 of the 9 the first time to ensure they don't crowd each other and will use the remaining 4 next time. Will certainly be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: kmatthews

customer_reviews.title: This is my second year having an Aero Garden
customer_reviews.text: And this year, because the herbs did so well, I decided to try salad greens and tomatoes. I planted them 5 days ago and already my basil (of course) and thyme are sprouting as well as one of the tomatoes and two of the lettuces. I've never had good luck with dill, but I'm trying it again. So far, nothing growing with the dill. But all in all, I love the aero garden. The one thing you have to remember is only grow one basil plant. One is enough and will soon seem to want to take over the earth. It's the kudzu of the Aero Garden world!
customer_reviews.author: SnafoooTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: 4 weeks in and my greens look incredible! Everyone is raving about them; couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Fresh produce all the time
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed fresh greens when supermarkets were recalling different varieties. Enjoyed the tinder leaves and variety. When the plants get too big the leaves get bitter. Be sure to clip often. Thoroughly enjoyed my salads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grows fast and yields a lot of lettuce.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They grow fast and gave me more lettuce that we could use. I think next time I might not put them all in at the same time, stagger them so they mature one at a time. Great tasting lettuce. I think there were a couple of different varieties but they are all labeled the same. If my review was helpful to you, please click the yes button below! :-)
customer_reviews.author: John V. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Despite the higher price, my Aerogarden is saving me some major money. I travel a lot for work so a portion of my bag or box of lettuce usually gets thrown away. With having this mix I can have lettuce easily accessible for sandwiches or salads or even garnishes for dishes. And no more waste! The leaves are huge and have so much flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa MS

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GROWING. GREAT EATING.  EXCELLENT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Tasty too. I planted these on January 20th, 2018. Less than 30 days later I was picking of leaves for a nice salad. Perfect on the counter top in my very small kitchen and best of all I know where my lettuce came from. This is what eating healthy is.
customer_reviews.author: Scorp2Scorp

customer_reviews.title: Not normal product
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several of these kits without a problem. The order before this order had 3 pods did not germinate. On this order, one of the domes was missing which meant it could germinate either. So here is another kit that will not produce 6 pods of lettuce. Dates are still current so I am not sure where the problem is from. Seller or manufacturer?? Someone needs to figure out the issue and have it corrected. We really enjoy having fresh lettuce but it is becoming a problem lately.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Grow
customer_reviews.text: The lettuce sprouts and after growing to be about 2 inches the leaves turn brown and it dies after 2-3 weeks. Directions were followed so I don't know why this happened. Also a few days after purchasing this the price goes down. No refund for the difference was offered. Amazon sends you to Aerogarden and Aerogarden says they have no control over Amazon pricing. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Carol Miller

customer_reviews.title: So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why people are having issues with the pods but as long as you follow instructions you will get so much lettuce that you won’t believe. Mine started growing after 7 days so now it’s been 21 days and I have had two big plates full of salad. The salad taste so good and fresh I can never go back to buying romaine in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for Attack of the Killer Tomatoes!
customer_reviews.text: One of my pods labeled Romaine sprouted a cherry tomato plant. It was a bustling plant that quickly overgrew my AeroGarden disrupting growth of surrounding Romaine starts. When I tried to remove the Killer Tomatoes, I found its roots had a deathgrip on that of nearby Romaines. I had to abort the plant cycle and dispose all plants. I ended up with two useful Romaine pods which made this kit a horrible deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Skewbee

customer_reviews.title: Good product poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: My 6-Pod kit only contained five pods (Parris Island missing). I did not open the other two kits I received because they are sealed, and I don't want to open them before I am ready to plant, so I don't know if they are complete or not. I have been happy with AeroGarden in the past, but Customer Service has been completely unresponsive to emails about this problem and a non-functioning bubbler in my brand new unit which was a gift. Fortunately, YouTube users helped me to solve that issue, since I had already started the growing process before I found out the bubbler wasn't working.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzierock

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 out of Six Grew
customer_reviews.text: Only 5 out of six of the pods grew which was disappointing. I thought there were two duds but one did eventually grow. Update: The 5th was stunted and never produced much. The remaining 4 were nice lettuce heads though the leaves were sort of spotted. This is my first time using the grower so I'm not sure if that is normal. They tasted fine. I cut back the heads and was able to get a second smaller batch of greens out of them. I planted my own basil seed in the 6th dud. I now have a nice little basil plant.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Photo is wrong, description is right
customer_reviews.text: The description is right for this product, but the photo is wrong. This is a 7 pod of just salad greens. It is all the same type of lettuce. The photo shows 4 different kinds of lettuce. But the AeroGarden grows these super fast. I love having fresh salads every couple days. It is amazing how fast it grows too.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good germination rate, nice assortment of lettuce
customer_reviews.text: Germination rate of 80 percent, some pods did not achieve germination. Over all happy with the results and the lettuce tastes great. As for value for the money, lol the cost of the system and pods wipes any and all value for the money off the table. The farm plus and farm xl system works and works well but initial buy in is expensive, the pods and pod components are way over priced. That being said I do like the system and the quick results and plan to buy two more farm xl systems based on the simple operation and good looks in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviews had said most of the kit was ...
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews had said most of the kit was red lettuce. Out of the six pods four actually grew and three were red lettuce, one romaine. I was disappointed at the lack of variety and then that two didn't grow. I was able to harvest a few times before they started dying off. I wouldn't get this kit again. I had the herb set last time and was really pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Booknerd1106

customer_reviews.title: Amazing to grow salad year round
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this a couple of times and it’s amazing. I also have an outside, backyard garden that I use frequently also. I live in Sacramento, California and it gets extremely hot here. It’s difficult to grow a lot of lettuces during the summer and in the winter I’m a little lazier about gardening. With Aerogarden, I can have fresh home grown salad any time of year! My kids and I love to watch it grow too!
customer_reviews.author: Temperance Harkins

customer_reviews.title: Extremely quick and all of them grew
customer_reviews.text: My friends gifted me a harvest AeroGarden for my birthday. I decided to get the heirloom lettuce pods cause it had the highest reviews. Initially I wanted to grow herbs but the reviews for them are horrible. This began sprouting within just 3 days. I was shocked. There were 2 I thought were lagging behind and now have flourished. It's been less than 2 weeks and I'm still shocked at how all 6 are doing. They still have a month left to go to reach their peak fullness and I can't to see what happens!
customer_reviews.author: Cici

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and Safe Romaine.
customer_reviews.text: OMG, my lettuce is growing like crazy! It’s so nice not to have to worry about harmful bacteria because it’s growing in my own kitchen. Thanks Aerogrow!
customer_reviews.author: Shanley

customer_reviews.title: Spouted in a few days, salad in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: These things really grow like weeds once they start. I've been using the greens on sandwiches and such, as well as a few salads each week, ever since they started growing in. Thanks to the advice of a friend of mine who has a "real outdoor garden", I have been trimming the leaves which supposedly will help them continue to grow in longer. So far, so good. I am very happy with these pods, as they have been more useful on more things than the others herbs and such I have experimented with.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Sprouted, but unlabeled
customer_reviews.text: I got these pods for my aerogarden, and they all sprouted without any issues. However, I wish that they would have labeled them individually. All the pods say salad greens on them, so you don't know what kind of lettuce you'll get until they start to sprout. It seems like a pretty mixed box, so I don't think there's a standard number that you'll get of each. Worst case, you might end up with all of the same kind of lettuce.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N

customer_reviews.title: Poor product preparation by vendor Aero Garden.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of attempting item to be received this year. Nothing germinates, it is like attempteping to grow bricks. I took the two remaining pod on a piece of white tissue paper opened them up with a surgical blade and with a magnifying glass could not find any seeds. I believe in the processing of this item, Aero Garden had production problems which preventing the insert action of seeds, Now what are my next steps. I a getting a bit irritable having to package up the sets, go to UPS , wait for another delivery of a set of virgin seed pods.
customer_reviews.author: NASA GEMINI TEAM

customer_reviews.title: did not grow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 6 pods to go in my hydroponic grower. I received them and followed all directions to grow my lettuce. NONE OF THEM GREW. NOT EVEN A SPROUT AT ALL. . I was so disappointed. I waited hoping they were just slow growers , but nothing. after a month of waiting and nothing I decided to write a review. I have order these before from other companies and they grew good. thought they were all alike and not used this before . but will check better next time.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Oates

customer_reviews.title: Very good success rate!
customer_reviews.text: I started these before the new year and after 20 days, all plants have germinated and will be ready for an initial harvest soon. I plan to transfer these to my outdoor hydroponic garden and my community garden after the frost has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Fix-it With Fran

customer_reviews.title: Gross Mold!
customer_reviews.text: While my lettuce is sprouting every pod is covered in a gross greyish long mold. I sanitize my aero garden with bleach and then run water through it for a day between uses. I use boiled water in it. The only thing this can be from is the seed pods. The pods are contaminated I'm not even sure if this will be safe to eat. I've done aero garden numerous times without issue. I'm so disappointed. I'm trying to spray with warm water and vinegar and turned it on 24/7 light but I don't expect it to work out
customer_reviews.author: karolyne

customer_reviews.title: Its growing like a bomb...salad every  night
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with aero garden because I bought 2 units I have the herbs also. This is so easy. I am now on day 47 and I have lettuce and herbs that I have had to cut back 5 times. Holy cow...this stuff grows and its fun too. I wanted to try this and I am so glad I did. I will have fresh salad this coming winter for sure. Lettuce and tomatoes....oh yes
customer_reviews.author: Zen dancer

customer_reviews.title: EVERY purchase one pod doesn’t grow.  But I still love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love having the aero garden I live in the Desert so it’s great to be able to grow lettuce and herbs year-round indoors. But every and I mean every box I buy one of the pods doesn’t grow. I ruled out that it’s the unit because it’s different openings that it doesn’t grow. I have no idea how to even get credit for something like this so I’m saving up the dead pods thinking maybe I can get them replaced. LOL probably not I’m wishful thinking. But just before warned I found that it’s not unusual that not all pods work so really your price per pod goes up when one doesn’t grow.
customer_reviews.author: Shealeen ONeal

customer_reviews.title: virually foolproof and simple
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, and a benefit of changing technology with lighting. 99.5% of the time there are no problems with simply popping in a seed pod and letting it go. That's a pretty good average. The only thing that happens from time to time, is peculiar to the nature of the growing medium and not a product defect, what will occasionally occur, is that the growing medium fails to completely "break" gardeners use this term to describe the ability of a medium to absorb water. It's an issue easily fixed by wetting the top of the seed pod a couple times, and, due to the quick nature of sprouting, it's a situation quickly realized.
customer_reviews.author: kevin koffel

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED!!
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a mixture of salad greens. It turned out to be all one type of lettuce. Very small thin leaves. It was hard to get enough to make a salad for two. I may have made a mistake when I ordered more. I hope it’s not from the same company, but then again, I’m sure it was a mistake somewhere down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Sora

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Just over a week in, and all seven pods are doing great! The leaves on a couple of them are beginning to have a reddish-purple tinge to them; the rest are still green, so it looks like I have at least two different types growing. I take a picture of the crop each day, and I'm constantly amazed at how quickly they began growing (the second day, they sprouted). Cannot wait till they're salad-worthy...my mouth waters every time I think about it. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Grew
customer_reviews.text: None of the pods grew anything. Definitely do not buy it from here. Spend a little more and go to Aerogarden. They have regular sales on their pods and a much bigger variety of plants/herbs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Stu Art

customer_reviews.title: 5 days in and its sprouted
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little over 5 or 6 days in since i planted these pods and i already have sprouts formed and growing nice and strong. cant wait to see how it turns out in a few weeks Update: going well so far, one dome lid was missing but that's whatever in the long run. One pod is the runt of the bunch as well as you can see, hopefully it perks up
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Got one half growth cycle. Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. When the lettuce first came in, it looked great. Once they got tall, they started to get brown leaves on the bottom. I cut a few inches off of the tops because the plants were reaching the lamp and picked the brown leaves. The browning of the leaves accelerated and then nearly all of the plants died. I have had other Aerogarden plants (herbs), and have never had this sort of experience. Most unfortunate. I got maybe 4 cups of lettuce from the batch. Not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Candigirl1968

customer_reviews.title: Let us grow lettuce
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to grow with my 2 year old to teach her about plants and where food comes from. We had a great time checking the growth and had a pretty good yield. We grew enough lettuce for a couiple meals with three people.
customer_reviews.author: Evanski

customer_reviews.title: Only 1/3 of the pods germinate
customer_reviews.text: I have had great success with this in the past. They always grow great and give us fresh lettuce for months. This batch was completely different. I put three pods in and only one germinated. The one that did is beautiful but only having 1/3 of these germinate at this price is a total ripoff. I'm not sure if it is how these are stored or what but this needs addressed.
customer_reviews.author: P ShifTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Not labeled! They started growing a white fungus on them
customer_reviews.text: They all say mixed greens. Not really sure what I got. They are growing though but it would have been nice to know What I’m growing. Update they all have grown some kind of fungus on them. I’m a little nervous they ruined my other ones.
customer_reviews.author: ANR

customer_reviews.title: AeroGarden Mixed Romaine Lettuce Seed Pod Kit
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this salad to the other ones offered by AeroGarden. Amazon is not allowing pictures at this time, but a picture would be worth seeing. I'll try to attach a picture if/when Amazon fixes the issue. This salad grows tall and green. The other salad kit grows more out and flat. This is a better salad to eat because it is longer, crunchy, etc. All the seed pods were successful. I seen growth in a couple days, very small but visible. It grew quick and grows back fast. I cut the whole leave off at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Best Lettuce EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I love salads and I was not disappointed. The pod kit arrived as described. I put three pods in my Aerogarden and in less than a month I'm eating fresh picked lettuce that I grew myself. But this lettuce is even better than anything you can buy in the grocery store. I usually buy some kind of spring mix and sometimes the greens they use can be a bit bitter. Not these!!! They are delicious and make a perfect salad.
customer_reviews.author: L. Frances

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed with this purchase. I bought a set of six various lettuce pods. Four began to grow within the specified time (4-6 days) . Two have not grown at all even after 21 days. Considering the price per pod, I do not feel this is a bargain. I most likely not purchase Aerogarden lettuce combonevercagain.
customer_reviews.author: cinna lucy

customer_reviews.title: Organic greens
customer_reviews.text: It's been 45 days planted and I have lovely, tall lettuce. All 6 have grown. If I cut all 6, it's probably only enough for 2 salads, so I mix them with other greens for variety. They seem to be continuing to grow after I cut the leaves. I also throw them into my smoothies. It's nice to have organic lettuce on hand, and it doesn't look like the romaine in grocery stores. It's darker green and much sturdier, almost kale like.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Grows well, but...
customer_reviews.text: The pods grow well and abundant. The issue for me is that I've grown two 6pod gardens but each time 2 of the pods did not produce. I know that I can get nonproductive pod replaced but I'm genuinely disappointed by that <<<< 3 stars My herbs grew wonderfully and my lettuces were awesome! In 2 of the unproductive pods, I plant bell pepper seeds and got 2 really healthy plants, I'm just waiting for the peppers to show!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised by the poor quality of this product from AeroGarden. The kit was sold as a “salad mix”, but the pods weren’t labeled to provide any information regarding the variety or type of lettuce. In addition, the kit didn’t include the plastic pod covers (which was fine because I had several from previous kits). The lettuce grew, but was weaker than previous blends, and all pods yielded the same lettuce. So this wasn’t actually a ‘salad mix’. I would not gift this product or purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: All of the salad pods grew abundantly. The lettuce grew continuously for about three months before it bolted. The taste of the lettuce was great. I used the lettuce leaves for salads and on top of tacos. The lettuce held up well to salad dressing and salsa without wilting. I would definitely buy these pods again.
customer_reviews.author: Homestead maker

customer_reviews.title: Old seeds?  Missing top?
customer_reviews.text: Just received seeds. Germination “sell by date” expires in 3 days. One seed pod is missing a top. Didn’t notice these things until AFTER my son had started to set up his little garden. Will update my review after I contact the company. Update: company says seeds good for a year after sell-by date... All seeds have germinated. Company says they will send another top.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not labelled
customer_reviews.text: I love my aerogarden and I'll probably love these; but there is a major flaw and it irritates me. They are all only labelled as "Salad Greens". Unlike the herbs which list what each plant is; there is no way for me to know what is what until after it has sprouted.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Sowell

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 6 are duds
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Aero Garden herbs kit with 6 plants last month. I was thrilled with 5, but there was one dud. The others were so healthy that I didn't bother to comment on the one non-starter. Then I bought the salad greens mix. This time, 2 of the 6 didn't take. I am now very unhappy. I love the idea of starting plants in my kitchen and transplanting them to my garden. But, I don't like the idea of losing 1/3 of my crop!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Walker

customer_reviews.title: AeroGarden Mixed Romaine Lettuce Seed Pod Kit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this seed kit to go into my AeroGarden to grow romaine for my bunny after the return of the ecoli in romaine issues. Yes, the bunny is a little bit spoiled. 5 of the 6 pods sprouted within 3 days. When the sixth never did sprout I wrote to the company per their guarantee and they sent a new pod right out. The romaine grew and in just short of a month I had a lovely little lettuce garden for my bunny. He approves
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed
customer_reviews.text: So I understand that this is marketed as a salad greens kit, but I figured once I had the individual pods in hand that they'd be labeled with the variety of lettuce. They're not. All six have "Salad Greens" printed on them, so you have no idea what you're getting until you grow them. Are they still tasty? Sure! But I'd rather know what I'm getting before I spend all that time waiting for it to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing germination
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. All germinated and are looking great. I made the mistake of not checking on them for a while and it looks like every seed germinated. Looks like maybe 5 seeds in some. Oh well....lesson learned. I highly recommend these. Well worth the money. I also purchased the off brand pods and sponges. They work great as well. If money isn’t an option, I can say better things about these aerogarden pods. They are strong, germinate fantastic, and just WORK!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Melcer

customer_reviews.title: Best Aeropods yet!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I spend so much money on lettuce I figured I'd grow my own. Easy to use and maintain, and the lettuce germinated and grew pretty quickly. Obviously with an aerogarden you're not going to get huge stalks of lettuce, but mine have sprouted some pretty hearty leaves. I've been able to pick several times and they've re-grown very nicely. These have lasted better than any of my other aerogarden plants!
customer_reviews.author: Molly H.

customer_reviews.title: Mold
customer_reviews.text: Two of the pods so far developed mold just as they broke through the surface to start growing. I had to pull them out of the aerogarden. We're watching the other pods. If they all have a problem, we'll apply for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna I.

customer_reviews.title: Easy For Anyone to Have a Garden
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up and you can have produce or herbs for months from a single planting. I love the taste of freshly cut lettuce and am even happier that I know it is non-GMO and not sprayed with RoundUp or any crazy chemicals. It seems like it only takes days to regrow from the same pod.
customer_reviews.author: SF Hans

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: All of the labels just state salad greens so I’m sure of what the actual “green” is. I was hoping they would be labeled with the type of lettuce so I wouldn’t be guessing. 2 pods have yet to sprout and are labeled sprout 1-7 days. I’m on day 9 so I’m guessing those are duds. Again not sure what they are and if this is normal or not.
customer_reviews.author: Brantley D.

customer_reviews.title: The Pod Kits are not germinating
customer_reviews.text: We have two Aerogarden containers and always buy either lettuce or tomato pods. Over the years the products have not produced as expected. The 3 pod Heirloom Salad Greens that I purchased on July 8 2020 only had two of the 3 pods growing. This is now happening whenever I buy a new seed kit. At least one of the pods doesn't grow. Very disappointing considering that the product is not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Fresh Lettuce From My Basement
customer_reviews.text: I like Aerogarden hydroponic growers for their ability to deliver fresh herbs and greens. These romaine pods sprouted within days, and the first leaves were ready for harvesting in about three weeks. You do have to keep up with them by harvesting the outer leaves despite romaine's head-forming growth since a too-dense garden keeps all the leaves from getting the light they need. -- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lee WesselmannTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Some of the herbs and vegetables don’t grow
customer_reviews.text: I used it to grow herbs and vegetables. The dill didn’t grow at all. The tomato is having a hard time. I’m trying lettuce and different tomatoes to see if I can get them to grow.
customer_reviews.author: mlewj

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom Salad Greens Seed Pod Kit
customer_reviews.text: I planted these pods 14 days ago after cleaning my machine and filled it with fresh water and the nutrient solution. So far only 3 pods are growing and the other 4 are not. I have used these seed pod kits before and have had only one other time that one didn't sprout. I think it might be the kit was old or something was wrong with the seed.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Doswell

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you feed them only as instructed and change the water on a timely basis.
customer_reviews.text: I love how quickly the salad greens started growing. I have not started harvesting yet, but they are beautiful and it is so clean. Since the pods grow in water the roots are beautiful. My family members are fascinated and two are considering purchasing Aero Garden's of their own so that we may each grow different seed pods and when harvest time comes we will trade with each other. The very best part - the seed pods are non-GMO.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Cheri

customer_reviews.title: A year of tasteless food, and wasted money.
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted the Aero Garden last Christmas, and have had issues with every set of new pods. My last set of pods were the romaine lettuce. Only one lettuce pod grew taller than 3 inches, and 2 Pods never grew. The leaves are unhealthy, and wilting away. I keep fresh water in it and add the nutrients regularly. These pods are my fourth try with the Aero Garden. The last pods I grew were the cherry tomatoes. I got 25 teeny tomatoes after 100 days of growing. Definitely not worth the cost for the pods, and the tomatoes were tasteless. I am so frustrated with the “food” I have grown, I doubt I’ll use the Aero Garden again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Alice Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: My wife has bought me two different AeroGarden units over the past several years and we have especially enjoyed these salad greens seed sets. The mixture is great for salads, we've had consistently excellent success with these, and the greens keep producing for quite a long time. We've had several salads from the ones we're growing now, but when production is down, we'll definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: JPfromOH

customer_reviews.title: We love fresh veggies in the winter
customer_reviews.text: I have an outdoor hydroponic set up and my daughter in law and son bought me an AeroGrow for Christmas. So far I have grown lettuce. The lettuce is delicious! The kit came with herbs so right now I have lettuce and dill growing. It grows fast and you harvest the leaves and leave the stem in the machine and it will continue to grow more. We love fresh veggies in the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Been 'harvesting' fresh greens for 4 weeks now
customer_reviews.text: These pods have come in handy lately and provided just enough daily greens on my sandwich over the last four weeks. They were easy to grow and don't show any sign of stopping anytime soon. I will definitely be buying it again!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: QC did not earn their keep on this one. *Edit*
customer_reviews.text: I just started my pods, but the kit only came with five grow domes instead of six, and it looks like a couple of the pods already sprouted inside the packaging. My herb garden did great overall, but I'm not holding out much hope for this one. PS: Yes, I kept the herb garden grow domes, but no one messes with stuff like a curious four year old, so those things are MIA. Edit: changing this to five stars. It was still missing a grow dome, but I just put a plastic shot glass over it and it worked fine. All six domes sprouted and we got some great salads out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Even if you have a black thumb, you're good to go with this
customer_reviews.text: Follow the simple instructions, lettuce appears. I moved mine outside to the flower bed where they really took off. We have used and used these lettuces and they keep on giving. So tender, so delicious in a salad or on sandwiches. No more $3.79 a bag lettuce for us. When we need some we just go out and cut it and it grows back. I only did three, which I'm glad of or we would be overrun. I'll save the other three for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: milchoice

customer_reviews.title: Great lettuce in 20 days
customer_reviews.text: The lettuce was very tender at 20 days growth. Made a great salad for two. Just trimmed a few leaves off each of the 6 pods. Will try another salad in about 4 days. Should be good. Had plenty leaves left after the first salad. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Redbaron1701

customer_reviews.title: Wow! These really do grow fast!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using an AeroGarden and I wanted to have romaine for fresh salads. I saw the first little sprouts pop up after a day, and the attached photo was taken after just two weeks. I’m very impressed with this. I think I’ll be buying another, larger AeroGarden soon and will try for cherry tomatoes and herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mel M

customer_reviews.title: very happy with my aerogarden purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had great luck with my original aerogarden purchase i requested the salad garden and when i received the new seeds i was very unhappy the box was almost destroyed but i wanted to start my garden that day and a few of the seed holder plastics were broken along with the box i will never use this company again for my aero garden refills
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Salamon

customer_reviews.title: This is for a Hydroponic Garden, but I'm using it in potting soil
customer_reviews.text: I guess I missed the information about these seeds being for a hydroponic garden. But I planted the little rods anyway in my strawberry planters. They are growing great in a potting soil medium. Dill, several types of lettuce and tomatoes are smiling in my front yard. Comes with liquid plant food, which is a must to use with these seed pods.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS ✅✅✅
customer_reviews.text: I planted these on 2 January 2019. My photo says it ALL! 🥰😉. The second photo is this morning, 15 January 2019! I couldn’t be more pleased 😄
customer_reviews.author: Sharah T. HortonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Poor Germination Rate
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the germination rate for this kit. Of the 9 pods received only five germinated, and one of those plants was stunted and stopped growing shortly after getting the true leaves. I always clean my aerogarden bounty between plantings, used newly bought nutrient solution and used the correct settings on my aerogarden. So with optimal conditions less than half the plants made it. Of the plants that made it, I had two varieties of lettuce that grew to maturity and they were pleasant and fun to harvest. Just wish there was enough from this kit for a proper salad.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Purchased before Coronavirus
customer_reviews.text: We gifted ourselves the aero garden planters for Christmas and then I ordered this romaine which arrived before the Coronavirus outbreak in US. It’s been a delight to have a fresh grown vege without having to go to the store.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Young

customer_reviews.title: Never get six that grow
customer_reviews.text: We live in rural west Texas. The local chain grocery store seldom has good lettuce so I use AeroGarden lettuce or salad greens. Maybe once did all six pods grow. The first time or two of getting five viable pods, I called and the pod was replaced. But, then, that pod was not in sync with the others. And, I begrudge taking the time to go through the calling and waiting. Why can't they send six that grow?
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Bird

customer_reviews.title: Sprouted quickly... then it went downhill
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with how quickly the romaine pods sprouted and began to turn into little lettuce heads. My excitement went downhill after that though because the quality of the lettuce produced was very low. They appear "fully grown" but they are flimsy and soft. The size of the heads is very thin despite the height. They also reached the top of the light bar so the leaves were damaged. I was waiting to harvest until they filled out but that never came and I am just left with scorched, flimsy lettuce heads. Will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 1313

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to grow
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 plants germinated out of the Heirloom Garden seed pods. One pod is doing Ok..and 1 just died. I've tried herbs, also, and was happy only with the Thai and regular Basil. I've followed directions, and feel that my greenhouse window location may not be a happy place for the Aerogarden ;-(
customer_reviews.author: astro

customer_reviews.title: Foolproof and always fresh!
customer_reviews.text: So easy and fresh lettuce every day. Harvest one day and the next it’s still thick and lush. Very pleased as there is no waste. When I buy a head or package of lettuce I can never eat it all while it’s fresh. Grew herbs the first time and they were amazing! I never have been successful with herbs before.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6 pod aerogarden. I put in two romaine pods and only 1 sprouted. When you look into the one that didn't sprout it looks like a big hole where a seed should be. Hoping the rest of these pods sprout. They're not cheap for the quantity. The pod that did sprout was incredible and grew so fast. Had lettuce for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Beauty

customer_reviews.title: All 6 Sprouted In 4 Days, After Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: 14 days in the AeroGarden and nothing but mold! I requested an exchange and Amazon had them at my door 2 days later. 4 days since I received the replacement pods and all 6 have sprouted. I must have had a bad batch with the first ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brucato

customer_reviews.title: WHAT TYPE OF SALAD GREEN AM I GROWING?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 6 pods but planted only 3 pods on 6/6/2020. They sprouted in about 1 week and 2 dropped dead. I transferred to soil and able to have 1 growing tall . However, I wish they would have labeled which salad green you are planting! Can anyone tell what am I growing? Thanks
customer_reviews.author: CADD

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this and I thought it would be gimmicky. But here I am writing a review of how good it is. I’m getting ready to reorder and realize we bought this on Nov 4th. Today is Feb 2 and we just now threw out our first batch. You won’t be able to pick off it every day. But it’s still nice to have your own fresh salad mix during the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Scott

customer_reviews.title: Finally, greens that I like
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to add more greens to my diet. Fresh is so much better. The black seeded Simpson is my favorite in this pack. One word of caution, prune often so that the leaves don't touch the light. I didn't prune as soon as I should have so the plants didn't thicken out as much as they could have.
customer_reviews.author: J. Padelford

customer_reviews.title: Not all germinated
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 7 didnt germinate, Aerogarden will replace them if you call them but I have done that in the past and its a hassle to call just to get 3 pods. I think its a freshness issue.
customer_reviews.author: BevMonster

customer_reviews.title: Salad Greens for all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first AeroGarden 7 recently and with it purchased this Salad Greens Seed Pod Kit, it has everything you need to grow one season of fresh greens so you don't have to purchase additional kits; installing the pods in the garden was quick and simple and all the seeds germinated by the 5th day which was a relief. MiracleGrow stands by their product so if a seed does not germinate you can send it back for a replacement. Pros: 1 kit for everything, easy to setup no fuss. Cons: The cost for a kit is a bit high
customer_reviews.author: TheKeen

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband gave me the aero garden for Christmas and I absolutely love it. I recently purchased the romaine seed kit and it is amazing. The seeds germinated faster than expected and it is growing beautifully. I highly recommend. I have tried to grow lettuce outside in pots and have never had any luck. This picture is growth at about 10-14 days. You will love this!
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to eat more healthy food and this is a great addition. I know why many people have more than one garden now! These are quite tasty. They don't keep well in the fridge, so if I pick a little more than I need, or if I'm trying to thin it out, I am sad.
customer_reviews.author: JulieT

customer_reviews.title: Love having FRESH salads!
customer_reviews.text: I love having the fresh lettuce! I have a six pod AeroGarden but I ordered the nine pod kit. So glad that I did as one plant was just not producing as well as the others so I just replaced it and now we have lots more leaves. Having fresh lettuce is so much better than anything you can buy in the store. It is crisp and full of moisture. Doesn't keep very long in the fridge but I had to harvest because it was getting too crowded!
customer_reviews.author: Debb

customer_reviews.title: I love the aerogarden
customer_reviews.text: I've got two Aerogardens, and have ordered seed pods separately also. this batch came with one totally empty pod :-( Hence only 4 stars. Doesn't have anything to contact sender, so oh well. However the romaine pods do seem to grow like they are on steroids, so guess I'll just be missing the one. This is my second round of romaine.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Young

customer_reviews.title: I Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to grown anything. I got the herbs the first time and all grown but the Thyme. I put tomato seeds from a store bought tomato and it work great. Next I got the salsa combination. I still haven't produced any produce yet. It's been 6 months. However it got so big that I have transplanted to the outside garden and they did get stressed. I am now getting flowers on the pepper plants so I am hopeful. The last purchase for the Salad greens. Love it. Have harvested several salads out if it and have only had it a couple of months. However, again one didn't grow.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M Fugate

customer_reviews.title: Pod not growing.
customer_reviews.text: I planted my third garden last week. All pods have sprouted beautifully except for one of the lettuces. I am attaching a picture for reference. This is the second time I purchased garden pods from Amazon, but the first time that all pods haven’t grown. The lettuce in question is Parris lettuce. Is there anyway that I can receive a replacement pod? I am so bummed that this has happened. I will message Aerogarden for help.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Niece and family love it!
customer_reviews.text: My niece and her children are vegan due to food allergy issues. I purchased these pods to go with the Aero-garden she received last Christmas. Her children love 'gardening' during the winter and inclement weather days they've received this year. Plus, her preschooler enjoys salads now that she grows her own greens!
customer_reviews.author: Alto_Girl

customer_reviews.title: Months of fresh salads / greens very easy to grow and economical
customer_reviews.text: We have yet to exhaust all the pods from this purchase. Each pod seeded and grew within the suggested time period. Even after multiple harvests new growth continues to yield fresh salad. Recommend growing together with tomato plant. The plants continued to grow and take up so much root space that we relocated from the aerogarden and placed into a DIY 5gal aerator setup (pictured)
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The lettuce was just a few wimpy leaves and once those were cut off they never grew back. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Janice L

product_meta.title: AeroGarden Salad Greens Mix Seed Pod Kit
feature_bullets: INCLUDES SALAD GREENS SEED KIT - 6 Pre-seeded pods, featuring popular lettuce varieties: red/green leaf, romaine, and butter head
PLANT TO PLATE – Non-GMO seeds; No herbicides; No pesticides. Harvest lettuce directly from your AeroGarden for the freshest salad possible.
COMES WITH EVERYTHING - Also includes a 3 oz bottle of patented, specially formulated Liquid Nutrients, grow domes for optimal germination, and a Growing Guide with step by step instructions.
GERMINATION GUARANTEE - 100 Percent Germination Guarantee; if a Seed Pod doesn't sprout, we'll replace it for free.
WORKS WITH ANY AEROGARDEN - For use in all AeroGarden models.
